The boss effect means cards are drawn face down after each hand played. Since I can't see most of my cards, I need to make strategic decisions.

My last flush scored 12,210 chips, which was less than expected. I need 9,790 more chips with 3 hands remaining.

Let me think about possible strategies:

1. **Discard the unknown cards**: I have 1 discard left. I could discard some unknown cards to try to get better cards, but I won't be able to see what I draw.


2. **Play what I have**: I could play the known cards and some unknown cards, hoping to hit something good.
3. **Use my consumable**: I have Venus which levels up Three of a Kind. This doesn't seem immediately useful unless I happen to have three of a kind.

With 5 hidden cards and needing roughly 3,263 chips per hand on average, my approach hinges on what those unknown cards might be. Since Hearts dominate the remaining deck at 50%, there's a decent chance some of my face-down cards are Hearts, which could set up another Flush for my Crafty and Droll Jokers.

The other suits break down as Spades (23%), Diamonds (17%), and Clubs (10%), so I'm less likely to draw those. I already see 7 of Hearts, Queen of Clubs, and 9 of Diamonds in my hand. If I'm aiming for a flush, I should discard cards that don't match my target suit to maximize my odds. But here's the catch—the boss mechanic draws cards face down after each hand, so I can't actually see what I'm working with for the remaining two hands.

Since I need nearly 10,000 more chips and have limited visibility into my deck, I should focus on playing strategically with what I know. Discarding the unknown cards won't help since replacements will also be hidden. My best approach is to either commit to playing all five cards hoping for a flush among the unknowns, or play a partial hand using my visible cards and hope the unknowns complement them.

Given that the deck is 50% Hearts and I have the 7 of Hearts showing, discarding the Queen of Clubs and 9 of Diamonds to draw new cards gives me a chance at building a Hearts flush. If several of my hidden cards are Hearts, this could yield the high-scoring hand I need to close the gap.

I realize I only have one discard remaining after this, so I need to be decisive. Playing five unknown cards is risky—the odds of them forming a flush are slim. My best approach is to discard the non-Heart cards I can see, keep the 7 of Hearts, and rely on the probability that my unseen cards contain enough Hearts to complete a strong hand.

I'll discard the Queen of Clubs and 9 of Diamonds in positions 5 and 8.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
